Message:
The girl’s sleeping face,
illuminated by the full moon,
appeared so blissfully carefree.

At the very least,
I’d make it quick and painless
so she wouldn’t suffer long.

I took the knife in my hand
and brought it down
in one swift motion.

Just before the knife
could pierce her body,
I felt something stop me...

...A power that
repels harm, huh?
No wonder all of my previous
assassination attempts
had failed.

Before I could respond,
she pressed the hem
of her nightgown
against my hand.

The white fabric
slowly seeped in red.
My blade must
have nicked me
when it shattered.

“Don’t worry about it.
I don’t feel pain,” I said.

The girl looked shocked,
but quickly averted her gaze.

“Even if there’s no pain,
it doesn’t erase the truth
that you’ve been hurt.”

Those words caused
something in my chest
to twist and tighten...

Suddenly, the sound of
glass breaking pierced the air.

I sensed the presence
of multiple people...
Assassins sent by
the organization.
